channel.title: DTO
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from DTO, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Durable-goods orders pop as U.S. manufacturers race Trump tariffs
Dollar Tree is selling Family Dollar at a huge loss. Its stock is rising anyway.
EU says 'unconditional withdrawal' of Russia from Ukraine is a precondition to amend sanctions
item.description: The withdrawal of all Russian forces from Ukraine would be one of the main conditions to lift or amend EU sanctions, a European Commission spokesperso...

item.title: The Atlantic publishes full Signal thread with Hegseth, Waltz after Trump says texts not classified

item.title: Economic calendar: Investor ears peeled for durable-goods data and Fed speakers
Stocks could be set up for a first-half-of-April rally. Tax Day is a factor.
Europe wants to pour billions of dollars into its own defense companies — but market watchers say it may not be able to shut American firms out
item.description: As Europe looks to hike defense spending, CNBC spoke to industry experts about how the money could be spent — and where it leaves U.S. firms.

item.title: Blue-chip Dow up 200 points as it aims for fourth straight gain — live updates
